intro: Myosotis discolor subsp. balbisiana, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a species of flowering plant in the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream sides. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners, though it can be invasive in some regions.
